trans-unit.source: The <codeph>derbyrun.jar</codeph> file is a special JAR file that simplifies how you invoke the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> tools and the Network Server.

seg-source.mrk: The <codeph>derbyrun.jar</codeph> file is a special JAR file that simplifies how you invoke the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> tools and the Network Server.

target.mrk: The <codeph>derbyrun.jar</codeph> file is a special JAR file that simplifies how you invoke the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> tools and the Network Server.

trans-unit.source: With the <codeph>derbyrun.jar</codeph> file, you can run the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> tools and utilities using shortened names and you do not need to set the java CLASSPATH environment variable. The <codeph>derbyrun.jar</codeph> file must be in the same folder as the other <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> JAR files.

seg-source.mrk: With the <codeph>derbyrun.jar</codeph> file, you can run the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> tools and utilities using shortened names and you do not need to set the java CLASSPATH environment variable.
The <codeph>derbyrun.jar</codeph> file must be in the same folder as the other <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> JAR files.

target.mrk: With the <codeph>derbyrun.jar</codeph> file, you can run the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> tools and utilities using shortened names and you do not need to set the java CLASSPATH environment variable.
The <codeph>derbyrun.jar</codeph> file must be in the same folder as the other <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> JAR files.

trans-unit.source: The following table shows the syntax for using <codeph>derbyrun.jar</codeph> for each of the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> tools.

seg-source.mrk: The following table shows the syntax for using <codeph>derbyrun.jar</codeph> for each of the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> tools.

target.mrk: The following table shows the syntax for using <codeph>derbyrun.jar</codeph> for each of the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> tools.

trans-unit.source: This table shows the syntax for using <codeph>derbyrun.jar</codeph> on UNIX and Windows systems.

seg-source.mrk: This table shows the syntax for using <codeph>derbyrun.jar</codeph> on UNIX and Windows systems.

target.mrk: This table shows the syntax for using <codeph>derbyrun.jar</codeph> on UNIX and Windows systems.

trans-unit.source: java -jar $DERBY_HOME/lib/derbyrun.jar ij [-p propertiesfile] [sql_script] java -jar $DERBY_HOME/lib/derbyrun.jar sysinfo [-cp ...] [-cp help] java -jar $DERBY_HOME/lib/derbyrun.jar dblook [arg]* (or no arguments for usage) java -jar $DERBY_HOME/lib/derbyrun.jar server [arg]* (or no arguments for usage)

java -jar %DERBY_HOME%\lib\derbyrun.jar ij [-p propertiesfile] [sql_script] java -jar %DERBY_HOME%\lib\derbyrun.jar sysinfo [-cp ...] [-cp help] java -jar %DERBY_HOME%\lib\derbyrun.jar dblook [arg]* (or no arguments for usage) java -jar %DERBY_HOME%\lib\derbyrun.jar server [arg]* (or no arguments for usage)
To see this syntax reminder, run the command <codeph>java -jar derbyrun.jar</codeph> with no arguments.

seg-source.mrk: To see this syntax reminder, run the command <codeph>java -jar derbyrun.jar</codeph> with no arguments.

target.mrk: To see this syntax reminder, run the command <codeph>java -jar derbyrun.jar</codeph> with no arguments.

trans-unit.source: You cannot use the <codeph>-cp</codeph> argument or the CLASSPATH environment variable to set CLASSPATH variables when you are using the <codeph>-jar</codeph> argument to start the <codeph>ij</codeph> tool. If you want to run the <codeph>ij</codeph> tool with a custom classpath, you cannot use the <codeph>-jar</codeph> argument. Instead, you have to use the full class name to start the <codeph>ij</codeph> tool (<codeph>java org.apache.derby.tools.ij</codeph>).

seg-source.mrk: You cannot use the <codeph>-cp</codeph> argument or the CLASSPATH environment variable to set CLASSPATH variables when you are using the <codeph>-jar</codeph> argument to start the <codeph>ij</codeph> tool.
If you want to run the <codeph>ij</codeph> tool with a custom classpath, you cannot use the <codeph>-jar</codeph> argument.
Instead, you have to use the full class name to start the <codeph>ij</codeph> tool (<codeph>java org.apache.derby.tools.ij</codeph>).

target.mrk: You cannot use the <codeph>-cp</codeph> argument or the CLASSPATH environment variable to set CLASSPATH variables when you are using the <codeph>-jar</codeph> argument to start the <codeph>ij</codeph> tool.
If you want to run the <codeph>ij</codeph> tool with a custom classpath, you cannot use the <codeph>-jar</codeph> argument.
Instead, you have to use the full class name to start the <codeph>ij</codeph> tool (<codeph>java org.apache.derby.tools.ij</codeph>).

trans-unit.source: See <xref href="tgs26250.dita#tgs26250"/> for more information about setting up the classpath and running the <codeph>ij</codeph> tool.

seg-source.mrk: See <xref href="tgs26250.dita#tgs26250"/> for more information about setting up the classpath and running the <codeph>ij</codeph> tool.

target.mrk: See <xref href="tgs26250.dita#tgs26250"/> for more information about setting up the classpath and running the <codeph>ij</codeph> tool.

trans-unit.source: There is no such limitation when you run the <codeph>sysinfo</codeph> tool. See <xref href="tgsrunningsysinfo.dita#tgsrunningsysinfo"/> for more information on running the <codeph>sysinfo</codeph> tool.

seg-source.mrk: There is no such limitation when you run the <codeph>sysinfo</codeph> tool.
See <xref href="tgsrunningsysinfo.dita#tgsrunningsysinfo"/> for more information on running the <codeph>sysinfo</codeph> tool.

target.mrk: There is no such limitation when you run the <codeph>sysinfo</codeph> tool.
See <xref href="tgsrunningsysinfo.dita#tgsrunningsysinfo"/> for more information on running the <codeph>sysinfo</codeph> tool.

trans-unit.source: The <codeph>server</codeph> argument is a shortcut for running the <codeph>NetworkServerControl</codeph> tool. For details on using this tool, see the <cite><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citadmin"></ph></cite>.

seg-source.mrk: The <codeph>server</codeph> argument is a shortcut for running the <codeph>NetworkServerControl</codeph> tool.
For details on using this tool, see the <cite><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citadmin"></ph></cite>.

target.mrk: The <codeph>server</codeph> argument is a shortcut for running the <codeph>NetworkServerControl</codeph> tool.
For details on using this tool, see the <cite><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citadmin"></ph></cite>.

trans-unit.source: For more information on using <codeph>derbyrun.jar</codeph> to run the <codeph>ij</codeph>, <codeph>sysinfo</codeph>, and <codeph>dblook</codeph> tools, see the <cite><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citutilities"></ph></cite>.

seg-source.mrk: For more information on using <codeph>derbyrun.jar</codeph> to run the <codeph>ij</codeph>, <codeph>sysinfo</codeph>, and <codeph>dblook</codeph> tools, see the <cite><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citutilities"></ph></cite>.

target.mrk: For more information on using <codeph>derbyrun.jar</codeph> to run the <codeph>ij</codeph>, <codeph>sysinfo</codeph>, and <codeph>dblook</codeph> tools, see the <cite><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citutilities"></ph></cite>.
